work.name: mi|im
highlights: Developed and deployed two Angular web applications, now used daily by around 20 internal users.

Designed and implemented a comprehensive test suite with Jasmine and Cypress for unit and end-to-end testing, integrated with CircleCI to streamline the CI/CD pipeline, improving deployment speed and reliability.
Developed RESTful API endpoints using Java and PostgreSQL, enabling seamless communication between back-end services and front-end applications.
Automated infrastructure provisioning and deployment using Terraform, leveraging AWS S3 and CloudFront for static website hosting.
Enhanced data processing efficiency by implementing a trajectory similarity algorithm in Python.
Contributed to system reliability through on-call support, diagnosing and resolving errors and performance issues to maintain optimal system health.

work.name: Akamai
highlights: Optimized server allocation across geographic regions by implementing a bin packing heuristic to improve resource utilization.
Built a data pipeline for comparing and analyzing real-time and forecasted traffic data using Python, SQL, and Bash, enabling data-driven decision-making.
Developed knee detection algorithms to estimate cache space requirements for specific content classes, leveraging cache hit graphs to optimize resource allocation.

work.name: ngram health
highlights: Created augmented reality (AR) scenes using A-Frame, designed as digital pet therapy to enhance the well-being of elderly individuals.
Designed and optimized 3D assets in Blender for use in AR environments, ensuring high-quality and engaging user experiences.

work.name: InstaDeep
highlights: Conducted a literature review on the 3D bin packing problem, summarizing recent advancements and key methodologies.
Implemented optimization heuristics in Python to enhance volume utilization in existing 3D bin packing algorithms.

work.name: COMMIT Group (MIT CSAIL)
highlights: Researched regular expression matching algorithms and optimization techniques used by engines like RE2 and Hyperscan, identifying key improvements for performance.
Developed a high-performance regular expression library in C++ using multi-stage programming with BuildIt, optimizing matching speed and efficiency.

work.name: CAP Group (MIT CSAIL)
highlights: Automated method signature and docstring generation in Python from natural language app descriptions using GPT-3, streamlining development documentation.
Developed a new web application feature in ReactJS to showcase and demonstrate the automated method signature generation process.

work.name: COMMIT Group (MIT CSAIL)
highlights: Developed a high-performance convolution library in C++ using multi-stage programming with BuildIt, optimizing for computational efficiency.

Designed and implemented custom code generation for arbitrary dimensions, incorporating advanced scheduling techniques such as parallelization, vectorization, loop tiling, and unrolling for performance optimization.

work.name: COMMIT Group (MIT CSAIL)
highlights: Developed a high-performance convolution library in C++ using multi-stage programming with BuildIt, optimizing for computational efficiency.

Designed and implemented custom code generation for arbitrary dimensions, incorporating advanced scheduling techniques such as parallelization, vectorization, loop tiling, and unrolling for performance optimization.

work.name: ALFA Group (MIT CSAIL)
highlights: Implemented adversarial attacks on code-related machine learning models by performing optimally selected Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) transformations.
Developed a robust evaluation pipeline using PyTorch to test model performance under adversarial conditions, enhancing the resilience of state-of-the-art models.
Utilized Python and Bash scripting to automate the creation and application of AST transformations, integrating them within Docker containers for reproducibility and scalable testing.
Results from this research were published at ICLR 2021 and SANER 2023

work.name: International Institute of Information Technology (IIIT)
work.position: Information Retrieval and Extraction Lab Intern
highlights: Developed a binary classifier using traditional machine learning models to differentiate body shaming posts from other content on Instagram, leveraging scraped data based on hashtags.
Scraped Instagram posts using Python to create a labeled dataset, ensuring accurate content for model training and evaluation.
Built a user-friendly interface with Python and Flask to showcase the classifier's functionality, allowing interactive testing and demonstration.
The project's outcomes were published at Soc Info 2022 (International Conference on Social Informatics), contributing to the field of content moderation and social media analytics.
